metadata.title: CVE-2021-39713 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-173788806References:Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39713` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-190-generic - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-3.13.0-190-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-3.13.0-190-lowlatency - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-190-generic - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-190-lowlatency - 3.13.0-190.241
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-224-generic - 4.4.0-224.257~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-224-generic - 4.4.0-224.257~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-224-lowlatency - 4.4.0-224.257~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1104-aws - 4.4.0-1104.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-190.241').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-224.257~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1104.109').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
